offset.desc: Offset (pixels) to bottom of Infinite Scroll container from which the component should start loading more content in advance

scrollTarget.desc: CSS selector or DOM element to be used as scroll container instead of the auto detected one

reverse.desc: Scroll area should behave like a messenger - starting scrolled to bottom and loading when reaching the top

loading.desc: Slot displaying something while loading content; Example: QSpinner

load.desc: Emitted when Infinite Scroll needs to load more data

index.desc: The index parameter can be used to make some sort of pagination on the content you load. It takes numeric values starting with 1 and incrementing with each call

done.desc: Function to call when you made all necessary updates. DO NOT forget to call it otherwise your loading message will continue to be displayed

stop.desc: Stops QInfiniteScroll if it's Boolean 'true'; Specify it in case there's nothing more to load

poll.desc: Checks scroll position and loads more content if necessary

trigger.desc: Tells Infinite Scroll to load more content, regardless of the scroll position

stop.desc: Stops working, regardless of scroll position

resume.desc: Starts working. Checks scroll position upon call and if trigger is hit, it loads more content

updateScrollTarget.desc: Updates the scroll target; Useful when the parent elements change so that the scrolling target also changes
